thread.title: Africa: Media Entrepeneur Peace Hyde Joins Forbes Africa

title: Africa: Media Entrepeneur Peace Hyde Joins Forbes Africa
text:
Ghana: Doctors Strike Is Threat to Life and National Security - Part One 
Peace Hyde holds a 1st class degree in psychology from Middlesex University. Peace Hyde has two masters under her belt, an MA in Communication and digital media and Masters in Journalism from the London school of Journalism. Over the past 3 years, she started an education consultancy, which provides expertise in education systems and policies, efficiency management as well as introducing the use of information technology in the classroom. 
The premium business magazine has profiled giants like Africa's richest man, Aliko Dangote, Tony Elumelu and Femi Otedola. The magazine also most recently profiled Arunma Oteh, the recently appointed VP of Treasure for the World Bank. Nigeria
